intro: Thonningia dubia, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Thonningia dubia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
